isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - INSTALL - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Tighten the middle bolt on each countershaft strap until the countershafts are snug. Shift the reduction sliding clutch into reduction. Attach a chain hoist to the output shaft.

note.para: The front box sliding clutches must be in the neutral position.

step1.para: With the transmission set in the vertical position, block under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft and position the new gasket on the transmission case ( Figure 271). Lower the auxiliary assembly on the front case rear.

figure.caption: Figure 271. Set Transmission in Vertical Position

step1.para: Install the retaining bolts in the auxiliary housing flange and tighten to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N· m) ( Figure 272).

figure.caption: Figure 272. Install Retaining Bolts and Tighten

step1.para: Remove the countershaft straps. Make sure a 0.125 countershaft rear bearing shim is installed ( Figure 273). Be sure the countershaft rear bearing races are seated in the bearing bores.

figure.caption: Figure 273. Make Sure 0.125 Countershaft Rear Bearing Shim is Installed

step1.para: Install two clean 3/8 inch x 1 inch bolts without washers directly across from each other in each bearing cover ( Figure 274). Tapped holes in the auxiliary case must be free of thread adhesive.
Tighten the bolts to 7 in-lbs. (.8 N· m) ( Figure 275). DO NOT INSTALL THE COUNTERSHAFT REAR BEARING COVER GASKET.

Rotate the output shaft six times in the clockwise direction, then six times counterclockwise to seat the countershaft rear bearings. Use a feeler gauge, as close the one bolt location as possible, and measure the gap between the countershaft rear bearing cover and the auxiliary case ( Figure 276). Record the measurement. Using the average measurement, refer to the SHIMMING CHART. Select the numbers in the left column that compare to the average measurement recorded from the countershaft rear bearing cover. Follow the column to the right to identify the proper shim to be used in the countershaft shim bores. Duplicate this procedure for the other countershaft rear bearing cover.

figure.caption: Figure 276. Measure Gap Between Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover and Auxiliary Case

step1.para: Remove the countershaft rear bearing covers and gauging shims ( Figure 277).

figure.caption: Figure 277. Remove Countershaft Rear Bearing Covers and Gauging Shims

step1.para: After the correct shim has been selected, place the shim on the rear countershaft bearing race and install the countershaft rear bearing cover and gasket ( Figure 278). Check for proper shim alignment. If misaligned, the rear bearing cover may be damaged when torque is applied. Position a new gasket on each countershaft rear bearing cover mounting surface and install both rear bearing covers. Install and tighten the bolts to 35 to 45 ft-lbs. (47 to 61 N· m).

figure.caption: Figure 278. Install Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover and Gasket
